title: Elementos dos org√£os sociais do Pa√ßos de Ferreira apresentam a demiss√£o
text: Dois membros dos org√£os sociais do Pa√ßos de Ferreira demitiram-se das suas fun√ß√µes no clube, face a diverg√™ncias sobre as pol√≠ticas adotadas pela dire√ß√£o presidida por Paulo Meneses. O cerne da disc√≥rdia passa pela cria√ß√£o de uma SAD. Em declara√ß√µes ao Jornal Imediato, Duarte Dias, ex-elemento do n√∫cleo administrativo, assegurou que a ¬´falta de projeto para o clube e o estado de coma em que se encontra¬ª originou o respetivo pedido de demiss√£o: ¬´Acredito no clube, acredito na sua viabilidade sem a altera√ß√£o de modelo para SAD. Mas entendo que √© preciso que se pense, a s√©rio, num projeto para o Pa√ßos de Ferreira.¬ª J√° S√©rgio Pereira, que pertencia ao Conselho Fiscal, referiu que esta altera√ß√£o significativa vai levar a uma ¬´perda de identidade¬ª dos castores: ¬´N√£o fazia sentido remar contra a mar√© e por isso decidi apresentar a demiss√£o¬ª, refor√ßou ainda. Recorde-se que Paulo Meneses pediu, recentemente, o prolongamento do prazo respetivo √†s negocia√ß√µes com os parceiros que est√£o a favor da constitui√ß√£o da SAD. No entanto, a data definida j√° foi ultrapassada, n√£o tendo existido novas informa√ß√µes sobre o pedido.

author: Dylan Bailey
title: Gran Tierra Energy Unveils New Credit Facility Worth $75 Million
text:
Gran Tierra Energy Unveils New Credit Facility Worth $75 Million
Dylan BaileyUpdated: 04-16-2025 06:30 PM
Gran Tierra Energy Secures New $75 Million Credit Facility
Gran Tierra Energy Inc. (NYSE American: GTE)(TSX: GTE)(LSE: GTE) has recently announced an exciting advancement through its wholly owned subsidiary, Gran Tierra Energy Colombia GmbH. The company has successfully entered into a reserve-based lending facility valued at up to US$75 million. This new facility aims to strengthen the company‚Äôs financial position and support its ongoing operations.
Importance of the New Facility
Ryan Ellson, Chief Financial Officer of Gran Tierra, shared his enthusiasm about the new credit facility, emphasizing its importance for both liquidity and for reinforcing the strength of the company‚Äôs business model amidst market turbulence. With a final maturity date set to occur in 36 months from the closing date, this facility showcases not only Gran Tierra's robust asset quality but also their dependable cash flow generation. This is pivotal for maintaining partner confidence and advancing the company‚Äôs strategic objectives.
Key Features of the Lending Facility
This lending facility brings several key benefits designed to bolster Gran Tierra's operational capabilities:
- A total commitment of US$75 million, with annual redetermination starting May 1, 2026.
- Interest on the facility is calculated based on a Term Secured Overnight Financing Rate plus a margin of 4.50% per year.
- The facility matures 36 months from the closure date, ensuring a solid timeline for repayment.
- All principal amounts, interest, and related payments are due by the maturity date, with an option for prepayment without penalties.
- This loan is secured against economic rights over specific contracts and Gran Tierra‚Äôs Colombian commercial establishment.
About Gran Tierra Energy
Gran Tierra Energy is an independent global energy firm that focuses on oil and natural gas exploration and production across a diverse range of locations, including Canada, Colombia, and Ecuador. The company is dedicated to nurturing its existing portfolio and seeks additional growth opportunities to further enhance its market position. Investors can follow Gran Tierra‚Äôs activities through its publicly traded stock on various exchanges, including NYSE American, Toronto, and London.
Contact for Inquiries
For media requests or investor relations, you may reach out to:
Gary Guidry, President & Chief Executive Officer
Ryan Ellson, Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer
Contact Number: +1-403-265-3221
Email: info@grantierra.com
Frequently Asked Questions
What is the primary purpose of the new credit facility?
The new credit facility aims to enhance Gran Tierra's liquidity, support operational flexibility, and contribute to long-term value for stakeholders.
How long does the credit facility last?
The credit facility has a final maturity date of 36 months from the closing date, providing ample time for Gran Tierra to manage its obligations.
What are the key financial terms of the facility?
The facility includes a commitment of US$75 million, interest based on a Term Secured Overnight Financing Rate plus a 4.50% margin, and flexible repayment options.
Where does Gran Tierra Energy operate?
Gran Tierra Energy operates primarily in Canada, Colombia, and Ecuador, with a focus on oil and natural gas exploration and production.
How can investors contact Gran Tierra for more information?
Investors can reach Gran Tierra by calling +1-403-265-3221 or emailing info@grantierra.com for inquiries.
About The Author
Contact Dylan Bailey privately here. Or send an email with ATTN: Dylan Bailey as the subject to contact@investorshangout.com.
About Investors Hangout
Investors Hangout is a leading online stock forum for financial discussion and learning, offering a wide range of free tools and resources. It draws in traders of all levels, who exchange market knowledge, investigate trading tactics, and keep an eye on industry developments in real time. Featuring financial articles, stock message boards, quotes, charts, company profiles, and live news updates. Through cooperative learning and a wealth of informational resources, it helps users from novices creating their first portfolios to experts honing their techniques. Join Investors Hangout today: https://investorshangout.com/
The content of this article is based on factual, publicly available information and does not represent legal, financial, or investment advice. Investors Hangout does not offer financial advice, and the author is not a licensed financial advisor. Consult a qualified advisor before making any financial or investment decisions based on this article. This article should not be considered advice to purchase, sell, or hold any securities or other investments. If any of the material provided here is inaccurate, please contact us for corrections.

author: QUETALT CASALS
title: Viatge als or√≠gens de la Festa de Sant Sebasti√†
text:
On Catalunya
Viatge als or√≠gens de la Festa de Sant Sebasti√†
La recreaci√≥ hist√≤rica dels Romeus de Monistrol de Montserrat transporta els visitants fins al segle XVI, quan el municipi del Bages va sobreviure als estralls de la pesta
La Festa dels Romeus vol acostar els or√≠gens de la festa major d‚Äôhivern de Monistrol de Montserrat (Bages) a trav√©s de la teatralitzaci√≥ dels fets hist√≤rics entorn de l‚Äô√®poca, fa m√©s de 500 anys, en qu√® el municipi es va veure afectat per la pesta. En el marc de la Festa de Sant Sebasti√†, patr√≥ del municipi, des de fa m√©s d‚Äôuna d√®cada, la poblaci√≥ ha incorporat un certamen als actes festius, que transporta els visitants fins al segle XVI, quan la vila va sobreviure a la pesta. Dem√† i diumenge, el poble que viu als peus de Montserrat far√† un aut√®ntic viatge al passat.
El poder feudal del monestir de Montserrat sobre Monistrol i la seva influ√®ncia sobre el Consell de la Vila, la construcci√≥ del nou temple parroquial de Sant Pere, les escenes quotidianes del municipi al mercat i, sobretot, els efectes mort√≠fers de la pesta sobre la poblaci√≥ fan de fil conductor d‚Äôuna hist√≤ria que culmina amb la curaci√≥ de la poblaci√≥ de Monistrol gr√†cies al miracle del patr√≥ del municipi: Sant Sebasti√†.
La festa omple els carrers i places de Monistrol de Montserrat, que llueixen ambientats en l‚Äô√®poca i amb personatges caracteritzats que recreen la vida quotidiana de fa cinc segles. Mentre el visitant passegi pel municipi podr√† veure l‚Äôarribada del pare abat, les obres de l‚Äôesgl√©sia, els metges que tractaven la pesta, que s‚Äôhan convertit en la icona de la festa, i l‚Äôhospital. Tamb√© recordar√† la vida del poble amb el mercat, el safareig, la taverna, el bordell i els amants.
La pla√ßa de la Font Gran pren m√©s protagonisme i es converteix en un dels punts neur√†lgics de la festa, amb noves escenes i elements decoratius. Aquest any, des de l‚ÄôAjuntament de Monistrol s‚Äôha deixat l‚Äôorganitzaci√≥ en mans del poble, amb la creaci√≥ d‚Äôuna comissi√≥ organitzadora, que suposa una tornada a l‚Äôorigen, despr√©s de diversos anys de professionalitzaci√≥.
El ball del Bo-Bo, element distintiu
La Festa dels Romeus se celebra anualment el cap de setmana posterior a la festa major d‚Äôhivern, entorn del 20 de gener, dia de Sant Sebasti√†, que t√© com a eix central el tradicional ball del Bo-Bo. La dansa, declarada element festiu patrimonial d‚Äôinter√®s nacional, √©s l‚Äôelement m√©s distintiu dels actes organitzats per l‚ÄôAssociaci√≥ de Sant Sebasti√†, que any rere any renova el vot de poble al patr√≥ del municipi per la seva miraculosa intervenci√≥ per salvar-lo de la pesta.
-
Noves relacions afectivesParelles s√®niors que viuen separades, el model LAT en auge: ¬´Conservo la meva llibertat i no discuteixo pel comandament de la tele¬ª -
Entre Vila-real i l‚ÄôHospitaletCau un clan familiar que es va apropiar de 19 vehicles d‚Äôalta gamma d‚Äôun servei de subscripci√≥ conegut com ‚Äòel netflix dels cotxes‚Äô -
Comer√ßLa batuda en s√∫pers 24 hores va detectar una vintena d‚Äôinfraccions laborals -
Si compres per Shein, Temu o Amazon, atent a la nova estafa del paquet -
L‚Äôestrat√®gia comunit√†riaTusk crida al rearmament d‚ÄôEuropa i critica la pol√≠tica migrat√≤ria de la UE

author: Caitlin Rearden
title: Helping Harvest kitchen construction project underway at GoggleWorks
text:
READING, Pa. - A major kitchen construction project is underway for Helping Harvest Fresh Food Bank.
It will be located on the GoggleWorks campus and will allow the food bank to expand a number of its services.
"What will happen here, over the next 8 months or so, is we'll put a commercial kitchen and a set of offices in this building which will allow us to create heat-and-eat ready meals for clients in Berks and Schuylkill," said Helping Harvest president Jay Worrall.
Worrall says about 55% of food donations that come in are from the retail industry and sometimes they're not packaged for family use.
"What we'll be able to do in this space is take that kind of donation, break it down into a microwave ready meal that will be packaged frozen, and we'll be distributing those meals primarily to senior citizens in our community," Worrall said.
This will help the food bank continue to meet high demand and better serve those in need.
Worrall says the food bank will bring on a few new employees, but the organization plans to operate the kitchen a little differently.
"We intend to operate by providing culinary arts skill training to people. Maybe people coming out of incarceration, or people who are unemployed, people with developmental disabilities, and it will be those people's hands who are creating these meals as they are receiving that culinary arts skills training that we hope they will take into the job market," explained Worrall.
Helping Harvest expects to be able to begin cooking meals in the kitchen by the start of the new year.
"This will be a building that sat empty for we don't know, maybe 70 years, that will now be able to provide a variety of important services to the citizens of Berks County," said Worrall.
Scroll down for comments if available

author: Nastya Bobkova
title: Redmi 14C 5G : une nouvelle fuite r√©v√®le d'importants changements de performances par rapport √† la version 4G
text:
Xiaomi se pr√©pare √† sortir une nouvelle version de son smartphone √©conomique - le Redmi 14C 5G.
Voici ce que nous savons Selon les derni√®res fuites, le mod√®le sera deux fois plus performant que la version 4G, gr√¢ce √† un processeur Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 plus puissant.
Le nouvel appareil est d√©j√† apparu sur la plateforme Geekbench, o√π il a montr√© des r√©sultats nettement meilleurs gr√¢ce √† l'utilisation du processeur Snapdragon 4 Gen 2. Cela signifie que le Redmi 14C 5G peut offrir environ deux fois la vitesse de son pr√©d√©cesseur, qui est bas√© sur le Helio G81 Ultra.
Ext√©rieurement, le nouveau mod√®le sera presque impossible √† distinguer de la version 4G, mais parmi les principales mises √† jour, un √©cran 120Hz de 6,88 pouces avec une r√©solution 720p et une batterie de 5160mAh sont √©galement attendus. Xiaomi devrait pr√©senter ce smartphone comme un changement de marque du Redmi 14R 5G, qui a d√©j√† √©t√© lanc√© en Chine.
Le Redmi 14C 5G sera disponible en Inde le mois prochain.

author: Sufia Banu
title: 10 Wicked Women in Nazi Concentration Camps
text:
More than 5,500 female guards had reportedly served the German concentration camps. These women were at par with their male counterparts and were characterised with ferocious sternness, steeled heart and capable of sheer brutality. Here is a list of such 10 wicked women:-
10 Wicked Women Who Worked in Nazi Concentration Camps: 10. Wanda Klaff Before marriage Klaff worked in a jam factory. When the war broke out she got herself assigned to Stutthoff and served there for a year committing sadistic abuse on the prisoners. When the war ended in 1945 she was arrested by Polish police and sent to prison where she suffered from typhoid fever.
Later she was tried and sentenced to death for her inhumane crimes. During her trial she is known to have stated that ‚ÄúI am very intelligent and very devoted to my work in the camps. I struck at least two prisoners every day.‚Äù Having made this statement, we can safely conclude that she was not as intelligent as she liked to believe. She was publicly hanged on 4th July 1946.
See also: Top 10 most evil women in history .
9. Dorothea Binz (‚ÄòThe Binz‚Äô) Though beginning her career at the age of 15 as a maid Binz was unwilling to die like every other old maid. She applied and was chosen as a trainee guard in 1939. Since then she had been steadily rising in her rank from supervising camp laundry & kitchen to the bunkers where women were tortured and killed.
One cannot imagine or one does not want to imagine the horrors committed under her command during her deputy chief wardress-ship at Ravensbruck and later at Buchenwald. Witnesses have testified how this ‚Äúunyielding‚Äù woman beat, stomped, shoot, whiped and slapped the female prisoners under her charge continuously.
She reportedly had a lover, an SS Officer and together they often strolled around the camp grounds laughing and amusing themselves with the sight of women being flogged. In another reported instance of her brutality she chopped a prisoner to a bloody lump with an axe because she wasn‚Äôt working hard enough. After the wars Binz was tried and executed for her crimes on May 2, 1947.
8. Greta Bosel It‚Äôs both ironical and sad that a nurse would turn to killing. In 1939 Bosel was sent to work at the Ravenbruck concentration camp. There she held the post of ‚Äúwork imput overseer‚Äù which meant that she was among those who were to decide which prisoners should be immediately killed by gassing and which one‚Äôs could be sent to a small concentration camp named Uckermark when young girl between 16 to 21 years of age were kept.
Bosel was a true Nazi at heart and echoed the Nazi philosophy ‚ÄúIf they cannot work let them rot.‚Äù When the Soviet Red Army was approaching the SS of Ravenbruck decided to annihilate all the prisoners but they could not do away with all the prisoners so they fled. Greta Bosel and other camp guards (including Dorothea Binz) were captured. Following the Hamburg Ravensbruck War Crimes Trial, Bosel was executed on 3 May 1945.
In the above video Bosel and Binz among other SS guards are being sentenced for their crimes. Interesting fact: Bosel was hanged using the same noose as Binz.
7. Alice Orlowski Orlowski worked as an overseer at the Nazi concentration camps. At Majdanek camp she was regarded as one of the most brutal overseer; and no wonder, for she came out with unique torture practises like whipping prisoners across the eyes thereby making them unfit for work, which caused them being sent to execution. To finish off with as many people as possible she would throw little children on top of the people loaded in the trucks destined to gas chambers.
But near the end of the war, her behaviours surprisingly or rather shockingly changed. The death march from Auschwitz-Berkenau to Lolau witnessed the changes in her where she would often comfort the prisoners, provided water to the thirsty prisoners and even slept alongside them on the ground. Her behaviour is still open to debate.
Following the end of the war she was tried, found guilty and sentenced to life imprisonment but was released in 1957 having served only 10 years. However in 1976 Orlowski was called in for a second trial during which she died.
6. Ilse Koch ‚ÄòThe Witch Of Buchenwald‚Äô Or ‚ÄòThe Bitch Of Buchenwald‚Äô & ‚ÄòThe Beast Of Buchenwald‚Äô
Any discussion regarding wicked women in Nazi camps would be incomplete without her. She was the wife of Karl Koch, commander of Buchenwald and later Majdanek. ‚ÄòThe concentration camp murderess‚Äô was known to have skinned the tattooed parts of the prisoners‚Äô bodies after getting them murdered.
She kept them as souvenir and reportedly turned them to lampshades or book covers. She reportedly liked watching others getting tortured and raped and often encouraged guards to commit such acts in front of her.
In 1943 the Koch‚Äôs were arrested. While her husband was found guilty and was executed, Ilse was freed but was arrested by the US authorities later. Following this she served four years in prison and was again freed only to be tried for the second time. In 1951 Koch was convicted of incitement to murder and committing grievous bodily harm therefore was sentenced to life imprisonment. At the age of 60 she committed suicide in prison.
5. Juana Bormann ‚ÄòWiesel‚Äô Or ‚ÄòThe Woman With The Dogs‚Äô
Wicked Women Charlotte Pliquet, Ruth Astrosini, Juana Bormann, Gertrude Feist, Gertrude Sauer and Ida F√∂rster shortly after their arrest. Dated: 02 May 1945 She had joined the SS in 1939 to ‚Äúearn more money.‚Äù Juana was abusive and sadistic in nature. Her saga of cruelty can be heard from as many as three concentration camps ‚Äì Ravensbruck, Auschwitz and Bergan-Belsen. She was known to have a German shepherd towing by her side who was ready to tear the prisoners apart had she give it a chance to.
At any rate she often used the dog to torture prisoners. She was last posted in Bergan-Belsen in March 1945 and in the following month of April, when the British Army invaded Bergan-Belsen they found over 10,000 corpse and 60,000 prisoners at the camp. Juana Bormann along with her comrades were prosecuted and convicted of murder. She was executed on 13th December 1945.
4. Herta Bothe ‚ÄòThe Sadist Of Stutthoff‚Äô
She is famous for her defiant attitude when in an interview- taken sixty years after the war- she had said ‚Äì ‚ÄúDid I make a mistake? No. The mistake was that it was a concentration camp, but I had to go to it, otherwise I would have been put into it myself. That was my mistake.‚Äù You can see the video above.
A tall athletic built woman, Bothe served at the Stutthoff camp near Danzig. Comparatively her crime was not considered as brutal as those of her counterpart so her life was spared and she was sentenced to 10 years of imprisonment. In that same interview she had recalled with anger how the British troops had ordered the guard to bury the death bodies of the prisoners they had killed and that she was ‚Äòterrified of contracting typhus because the guards were not allowed to wear gloves or masks.‚Äô
She described how the arms and legs of the decomposed bodies came off in her hands when she tried to pick them up, and how lifting the emaciated bodies caused her back pain.‚Äô 90 years old Herta Bothe still lives.
3. Hildegard L√§chert ‚ÄòBloody Brigette‚Äô & ‚ÄòBeast‚Äô
Beginning in 1942, at the age of 22 L√§chert had served at Ravensbruck, Majdanek and Auschwitz. She was a former nurse and in the course of her brutal career she mothered three children. Following the Auschmitz Trial in 1947, she was sentenced to fifteen years in prison. Although she got released only nine later in 1956 her freedom did not last long.
In 1975 she was convicted of participating in the selection process at the camps. One of the survivors testified that she was such a savage that ‚Äúshe struck until blood showed‚Äù which gave her the nickname ‚ÄúBloody Brigitte‚Äù. She was also accused of releasing her dog onto inmates and therefore was sentenced to an additional twelve years.
2. Ruth Neudeck She was a woman with a mission; when in 1944 Neudeck came to the Ravensbruck camp as a trainee she very quickly managed to impress her superiors by her cold-blooded brutality. A French prisoner testified having witnessed Neudeck ‚Äúcut the throat of an inmate with the sharp edge of her shovel‚Äù.
Since then she has been notoriously famed as one of the worst female guards. Neudeck was found guilty of selecting and executing 5000 women and children for which she was later sentenced to death by hanging.
1. Maria Mandel (‚ÄòThe Beast‚Äô) Mandel was held directly responsible for the deaths of 500,000 prisoners at the notorious Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp. Having worked in various other camps she had managed to impress her superiors quickly and before long she became the highest commandant at the Auschwitz-Birkenau (she had to only report to a male commandant because according to the Nazi‚Äôs a man can never be subordinate to a woman).
An intelligent woman but a vicious sadist at heart, there are reasons for her being nicknamed ‚Äòthe beast‚Äô ‚Äì she would stand at the gate waiting for someone to look around at her then she would drag her/him out of the line and murder him/her. She often selected Jews to serve as her ‚Äúpet‚Äù until she got tired of them and sent them to be executed.
Mandel is reported to have enjoyed making selection of children to be killed. At the Auschwitz she had created the Women‚Äôs Orchestra of Auschwitz which performed during exit and entrance of working prisoners and also when they were sent to be executed. Mandel believed, it soothed the minds of the would-be dead and make her work more efficient. Estimated to have sent half a million women and children to death, Mandel paid for her inhumanity on January 24, 1948.
Extra stuff:
Sufia would like to recommend ‚ÄòThe Reader‚Äô ‚Äì both the book and the movie . The book was first published in 1995 & has become a part of holocaust literature and German literature. In the film adaptation, Kate Winslet has done one of her finest work (which bagged her Oscar) in portraying Hana Schmitz, a female guard at a Nazi Concentration Camp.

author: News Staff
title: Potential hepatitis A exposure at restaurant in Calgary's Kensington neighourhood
text:
Potential hepatitis A exposure at restaurant in Calgary‚Äôs Kensington neighourhood
Posted Feb 20, 2025 3:51 pm.
Alberta Health Services (AHS) is out with a public alert after a confirmed case of hepatitis A in a food handler at a Calgary restaurant.
The agency says the worker at the Meltwich location in Kensington prepared food while infectious and they are warning that anyone who ate food from the restaurant between Feb. 2 and Feb. 19 may have been exposed.
AHS says post-exposure vaccines are available for those within 14 days of potential exposure. People who ate at the restaurant from Feb. 6 to Feb. 19 are still eligible for the post-exposure shot as of Thursday.
People who ate at the restaurant between Feb. 2 and Feb. 5 are no longer eligible but should monitor for 50 days and contact a doctor if symptoms develop.
Symptom of hepatitis A include:
- tiredness
- poor appetite
- nausea and vomiting
- abdominal pain and fever
Those symptoms are typically followed by dark-coloured urine, light-coloured stools, and yellowing of eyes and skin several days later. Young children may not develop symptoms but can still be contagious, according to AHS.
The illness is most commonly spread through direct contact with an infected person, but it is possible for it to be transmitted through food and drink prepared by someone who infected.
Anyone with concerns are being asked to call Health Link at 1-866-301-2668 for an assessment.

author: Victoria Torres Benayas
title: Sigue la alerta por la dana en Andaluc√≠a, Baleares, Catalu√±a, Extremadura y Comunidad Valenciana
text:
‚ÄúMucho cuidado‚Äù con bajar la guardia, porque el episodio de lluvias torrenciales y fuertes inundaciones que ha dejado m√°s de 158 muertos continuar√° a lo largo de este viernes y del fin de semana y ‚Äútodav√≠a puede dar alg√∫n susto‚Äù, advert√≠a el jueves por la tarde en declaraciones a este diario Rub√©n del Campo, portavoz de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a (Aemet). Y as√≠ ha sido y bien temprano. A las 6.55, Aemet ha decretado aviso rojo ‚Äïla alerta m√°xima‚Äï por lluvias torrenciales en Huelva y, otra vez y ya van muchas en esta dana, por fen√≥menos ya observados pero no previstos. Huelva es este viernes uno de los puntos calientes, junto con Baleares. Adem√°s del rojo, hay avisos en cinco comunidades: Andaluc√≠a, Baleares, Catalu√±a, Extremadura y, una vez m√°s, Comunidad Valenciana. Hay avisos naranjas ‚Äïel segundo de una escala de tres‚Äï en Valencia, Castell√≥n, Tarragona y el archipi√©lago. En lo que va de d√≠a, se han recogido, 117 litros por metro cuadrado en Cartaya (Huelva) , 92 en Mazaricos (A Coru√±a) y 61 en Fregenal de la Sierra (Badajoz). ‚ÄúSe est√°n registrando lluvias torrenciales en localidades como Cartaya, con 117 litros en menos de tres horas, 70 de ellos en solo una hora. El aviso sigue activo, por ahora, hasta las 9.00‚Äù, ha explicado Aemet en un mensaje en X . Pasada esa hora, la agencia ha decidido alargar el rojo hasta las 12.00 primero y, luego, de nuevo, hasta las 15.00. En la zona, estaban previstas precipitaciones fuertes de 40 litros en una hora, pero no torrenciales ‚Äïse consideran as√≠ a partir de 60 litros a la hora‚Äïy se espera que contin√∫en con intensidad durante las pr√≥ximas horas hasta recogerse 140 litros en 12 horas. ‚ö†Ô∏èAVISO ROJO | Provincia de Huelva.
‚õàÔ∏èSe est√°n registrando lluvias torrenciales en localidades como Cartaya, con 117 l/m¬≤ en menos de tres horas. 70 de ellos en solo una hora. El aviso sigue activo, por ahora, hasta las 9:00
La #dana va a seguir provocando hoy tiempo adverso. pic.twitter.com/9fbyOAdTII La inusitada intensidad de la dana (depresi√≥n aislada en niveles altos) ha obligado ya a Aemet a lanzar cinco rojos en cuatro d√≠as: el martes en Valencia y M√°laga , el mi√©rcoles en C√°diz y el jueves, en Castell√≥n . Esta virulencia, junto con la persistencia ‚Äïel aviso especial era hasta el jueves y la situaci√≥n se va a prolongar al menos hasta el domingo‚Äï est√° sorprendiendo a los meteor√≥logos, que hablan de una dana at√≠pica o de una nueva generaci√≥n de danas , dopadas por el cambio clim√°tico . Aunque para hacer balance hay que esperar a que concluya, se est√°n produciendo numerosos r√©cords de precipitaci√≥n: por ejemplo el mi√©rcoles fue el d√≠a m√°s lluvioso en Jerez de la Frontera (C√°diz) desde que hay registros: 115 litros, de los que 81 cayeron en seis horas. Como ha recordado el presidente andaluz, Juan Manuel Moreno, a la poblaci√≥n en un mensaje en X, el aviso rojo indica riesgo extremo para la vida de las personas y para la integridad de las infraestructuras y de las posesiones, por lo que hay que extremar al m√°ximo las precauciones y bajo ning√∫n concepto desplazarse a ning√∫n sitio ni coger un coche y, sobre todo, no vadear pasos de agua, aunque lleven poca corriente. No hay que acercarse al cauce de ning√∫n r√≠o y hay que tener en cuenta si estamos en un lugar inundable y hay que ponerse a salvo. Aunque no est√© lloviendo en la zona, el caudal puede aumentar mucho y de manera s√∫bita, las inundaciones repentinas o flash-floods como las ocurridas el martes negro. Este viernes, d√≠a de Todos los Santos, es el inicio de un puente festivo en el que la DGT pide que no se viaje a Valencia y en el que es esencial consultar el estado del tiempo y de las carreteras antes de coger el coche ‚Äïexiste una herramienta de Aemet, Meteoruta, que permite conocer qu√© tiempo har√° en el viaje ‚Äï porque la dana va a seguir complicando los desplazamientos. Esta jornada, la adversidad se concentra ‚Äúen puntos de Baleares y de Huelva‚Äù y, de cara al fin de semana, la dana ‚Äúpuede volver a descargar tormentas en el Mediterr√°neo y alguna de intensidad fuerte‚Äù, resume el portavoz de la agencia. Con m√°s detalle, este viernes ‚Äúla situaci√≥n m√°s complicada estar√°, por un lado, en el suroeste peninsular, con chubascos muy fuertes en la provincia de Huelva‚Äù. En otras zonas de Andaluc√≠a occidental y el sur de Extremadura ‚Äútambi√©n habr√° probablemente chubascos fuertes‚Äù. Por otro lado, seguir√° ‚Äùcomplicada la situaci√≥n en el √°rea mediterr√°nea, en el sur de Catalu√±a especialmente y en el norte de la Comunidad Valenciana, donde los chubascos podr√°n ser persistentes, acumul√°ndose m√°s de 100 litros en 12 horas‚Äù. Esto, alerta Del Campo, ‚Äúpuede provocar de nuevo crecidas en cauces e inundaciones en zonas bajas‚Äù. Otro foco de atenci√≥n es Baleares, donde se esperan lluvias y tormentas ‚Äúmuy intensas‚Äù, con acumulados de incluso 50 litros en una hora, lo que puede dar lugar a alguna crecida s√∫bita de ramblas. ‚ÄúHay zonas de Mallorca, incluso, donde se pueden acumular en pocas horas 120 litros‚Äù, teme Del Campo. Esta misma dana ya dej√≥ cortes de carretera e inundaciones en Baleares el fin de semana pasado. ‚ö†Ô∏èContinuar√° la situaci√≥n adversa durante el fin de semana.
‚õàÔ∏èConsulta la predicci√≥n meteorol√≥gica y los avisos en vigor.
üöóAntes de viajar, comprueba el estado de las carreteras con la @DGTes .
üö®Sigue las recomendaciones de @proteccioncivil . https://t.co/ybCocl0XPK El s√°bado, proseguir√° la inestabilidad en el Mediterr√°neo, con chubascos ‚Äúde nuevo fuertes y persistentes en el sur de Catalu√±a, tambi√©n en la Comunidad Valenciana y en el archipi√©lago balear que, de forma m√°s d√©bil, se podr√°n registrar en puntos del tercio sur de la Pen√≠nsula‚Äù. El mayor peligro volver√° a estar en Baleares, donde el aviso es naranja , mientras que Catalu√±a y Comunidad Valenciana siguen en amarillo. A partir del domingo, ‚Äúla tendencia es a que la dana poco a poco vaya desapareciendo y a que la situaci√≥n sea m√°s estable‚Äù. La fase m√°s adversa del temporal estaba prevista en un principio hasta el jueves, ‚Äúpero es normal en situaciones como esta que se alarguen un poco‚Äù, explica el experto. As√≠, el domingo habr√° que estar ‚Äúatentos porque todav√≠a ser√° una nueva jornada con inestabilidad en todo el Mediterr√°neo, desde Catalu√±a hasta el Estrecho y Baleares‚Äù. Adem√°s, en la zona del sur de Tarragona, norte de Castell√≥n y puntos de Teruel, la misma de este viernes, podr√≠a haber tambi√©n tormentas fuertes o con persistencia. Estar√°n bajo aviso Comunidad Valenciana y Catalu√±a, ambas en amarillo . A√∫n el lunes, los chubascos podr√°n ser fuertes, especialmente en el sur de Catalu√±a, en la Comunidad Valenciana y en el sur de Arag√≥n. De cara al martes y a los d√≠as siguientes, probablemente habr√° una situaci√≥n m√°s estable, en todo el pa√≠s pero al d√≠a de hoy todav√≠a no se pueden descartar posibles chubascos una vez m√°s en el √°rea mediterr√°nea. Las temperaturas ‚Äúno van a variar demasiado y que ser√°n en general algo m√°s c√°lidas de lo habitual para esta √©poca del a√±o‚Äù. ¬øPor qu√© est√°s viendo esto?

author: Amy Russo
title: Helen Anthony sues driver who hit her on California trip
text:
Providence City Councilwoman Helen Anthony is suing the driver who struck her during a trip to California , causing 22 broken ribs and putting her in critical condition.
The Providence Journal on Thursday obtained a copy of the suit filed on Dec. 14 in Monterey County Superior Court. It names not only the 82-year-old driver as a defendant, but also the California Department of Parks and Recreation and the Point Lobos Foundation.
More: Months after being hit by vehicle, Helen Anthony returns to PVD City Council
What does the lawsuit allege? According to the suit, on the morning of June 10, 2023, Anthony was in a crosswalk within the Point Lobos reserve when one of its employees, driving a 2013 Polaris GEM electric vehicle , struck her. The suit states she had the right-of-way when she was hit, run over and dragged "underneath the vehicle for some distance."
Because the vehicle was electric, "it made no sound as it sped towards Mrs. Anthony," the suit said. The parks department was named in the suit as the driver may also be one of its employees.
More: Providence Councilwoman Helen Anthony spent weeks recovering from serious injuries in California ICU
The suit goes on to say that the driver, according to a California Highway Patrol Report, mistook the gas for the brake when he accelerated, crashing into Anthony.
The parks department declined to comment, and the Point Lobos Foundation did not reply to a comment request. It remains unclear whether the driver has already hired an attorney.
Anthony's attorneys are seeking damages including medical expenses, incidental expenses, loss of earnings, costs of the suit and other relief. Among the noneconomic damages Anthony seeks to be compensated for are "loss of enjoyment of life," emotional distress and anxiety.
Anthony did not comment on the suit.
The councilwoman's husband, Douglas Anthony, is also a plaintiff in the suit, and is seeking economic and noneconomic damages.
This is a developing story. More to come.

organizations.name: california department of parks and recreation
